working_definition: A Specific Learning Disability is a neurological disorder that affects one or more of the basic psychological processes involved in understanding or using spoken or written language. It may manifest in difficulties with listening, thinking, speaking, reading, writing, spelling, or doing mathematical calculations. The disability is not due to intellectual disability, emotional disturbance, or environmental, cultural, or economic disadvantage.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Dyslexia (reading difficulties)
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A learning disability that affects reading and related language-based processing skills, such as decoding, fluency, and comprehension.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Dysgraphia (writing difficulties)
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A learning disability that affects writing abilities, including handwriting, typing, and organizing thoughts on paper.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Dyscalculia (math difficulties)
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A learning disability that affects a personâ€™s ability to understand numbers and learn math facts.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Auditory Processing Disorder
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A condition that affects how the brain processes spoken language, leading to difficulty understanding and remembering what is heard.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Nonverbal Learning Disability
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A neurological condition that involves strong verbal skills but significant difficulties with visual-spatial, motor, and social skills.

common_presentations: Struggles to read grade-level text fluently
Trouble remembering math facts (like times tables)
Writes slowly and with poor handwriting
Difficulty understanding what was just read

accommodations_modifications.name: Extended time on tests and assignments
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces pressure and allows the student to demonstrate knowledge without being penalized for processing speed
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Writes slowly and with poor handwriting
accommodations_modifications.example: Student receives 50% more time on reading and writing assignments

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of audiobooks or text-to-speech technology
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Provides access to grade-level content for students who struggle with decoding text
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Struggles to read grade-level text fluently
accommodations_modifications.example: Student listens to an audiobook version of the class novel

accommodations_modifications.name: Reduced homework or alternate assignments
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Focuses on mastery of concepts rather than volume, preventing fatigue and frustration
accommodations_modifications.example: Student completes 5 math problems instead of 15 with focus on accuracy

accommodations_modifications.name: Graphic organizers
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports planning and structuring of ideas, especially helpful for writing tasks
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a story map to plan out a narrative essay

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of a calculator for math tasks
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Allows focus on problem-solving rather than memorization of math facts
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Trouble remembering math facts (like times tables)
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a calculator during long division exercises

accommodations_modifications.name: Oral responses instead of written work
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Gives students a chance to show understanding when writing is a barrier
accommodations_modifications.example: Student gives a verbal report instead of writing a paper

accommodations_modifications.name: Preferential seating
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces distractions and ensures the student can clearly see and hear instruction
accommodations_modifications.example: Student sits at the front of the classroom near the teacher

accommodations_modifications.name: Break tasks into smaller steps
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps with task initiation and reduces overwhelm
accommodations_modifications.example: Essay writing task is broken into brainstorming, outlining, and drafting stages

accommodations_modifications.name: Frequent check-ins and feedback
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Provides reassurance, clarifies misunderstandings early, and builds confidence
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher checks in with student every 10 minutes during independent work

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of spelling and grammar check tools
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports independence and reduces frustration with written expression
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a word processor with built-in spellcheck for essays

accommodations_modifications.name: Provide written directions
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports students who struggle to remember oral instructions
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher gives both spoken and written instructions for assignments

accommodations_modifications.name: Allow use of keyboard or tablet for writing
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps students with poor handwriting express their ideas more clearly
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Writes slowly and with poor handwriting
accommodations_modifications.example: Student types essays using a Chromebook

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of speech-to-text software
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports students who have difficulty with spelling and handwriting
accommodations_modifications.example: Student dictates writing into speech recognition software

accommodations_modifications.name: Allow frequent breaks
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Prevents cognitive overload and helps maintain focus
accommodations_modifications.example: Student takes a 5-minute break every 20 minutes during work

accommodations_modifications.name: Use color-coded materials
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Aids in organization and visual processing
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a colored overlay while reading text

accommodations_modifications.name: Simplify written instructions
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Ensures students understand expectations clearly
accommodations_modifications.example: Instructions are broken into short, clear bullet points

accommodations_modifications.name: Provide study guides before tests
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps students focus on key content and organize their studying
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty understanding what was just read
accommodations_modifications.example: Student receives a summary sheet of main topics before test

accommodations_modifications.name: Use visual schedules
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces anxiety and confusion about what to expect
accommodations_modifications.example: Student follows a picture-based schedule on their desk

accommodations_modifications.name: Chunk reading passages
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Makes reading less overwhelming and easier to process
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Struggles to read grade-level text fluently
accommodations_modifications.example: Passages are divided into small sections with questions after each

accommodations_modifications.name: Pair student with a reading buddy
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Builds fluency and comprehension with peer support
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Loses place while reading or skips lines
accommodations_modifications.example: Student reads with a partner during reading time

accommodations_modifications.name: Allow oral testing
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Gives access to show learning without writing difficulties
accommodations_modifications.example: Student answers test questions aloud to a teacher

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of checklists for assignments
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps students stay organized and complete all parts
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a task checklist to track progress on a project

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of a note-taking buddy or teacher notes
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Ensures students have accurate information when note-taking is difficult
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Writes slowly and with poor handwriting
accommodations_modifications.example: Student receives a copy of notes taken by a peer or teacher

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of fidgets or movement tools
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Improves focus for students with sensory needs
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Loses focus during reading or writing tasks
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a stress ball while listening to a story

accommodations_modifications.name: Peer tutoring or small group instruction
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Provides extra support and repetition
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty understanding what was just read
accommodations_modifications.example: Student joins a small reading group for additional help

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of timers for work periods
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Builds time management skills and sets clear expectations
accommodations_modifications.example: Student works in 10-minute timed intervals with breaks

accommodations_modifications.name: Allow answers to be dictated
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Removes writing barrier to allow demonstration of knowledge
accommodations_modifications.example: Student gives answers verbally to a scribe

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of visual aids or anchor charts
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Provides cues to support memory and understanding
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a multiplication chart during math

accommodations_modifications.name: Pre-teach vocabulary
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Improves comprehension of reading and lessons
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher previews key words before a science unit

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of interactive learning tools
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Engages students through hands-on and visual learning
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses interactive spelling games on a tablet

accommodations_modifications.name: Provide a quiet workspace
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces distractions to improve focus and task completion
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Loses place while reading or distracted easily
accommodations_modifications.example: Student completes work in a separate, quiet area of the classroom

accommodations_modifications.name: Allow extra processing time for oral questions
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports students who need more time to understand and respond
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Slow to respond to verbal questions or prompts
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher gives 10 seconds of wait time before expecting an answer

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of interactive whiteboards or visual models
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps students visualize concepts to support understanding
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty understanding what was just read
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher uses visual math manipulatives during a lesson

accommodations_modifications.name: Record lectures or instructions
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Allows students to replay and better retain verbal information
accommodations_modifications.example: Student listens to recorded instructions during independent work

accommodations_modifications.name: Provide sentence starters or writing frames
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Gives structure to students who struggle with written expression
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a writing template with prompts for each paragraph

accommodations_modifications.name: Highlight key information in text
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Draws attention to important concepts and reduces cognitive load
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty understanding what was just read
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher highlights main ideas in reading passages

accommodations_modifications.name: Repeat and rephrase directions
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Ensures students understand expectations clearly
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher repeats instructions using simpler language

accommodations_modifications.name: Allow retakes on tests and quizzes
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports mastery learning and reduces pressure
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Anxiety or inconsistent performance on assessments
accommodations_modifications.example: Student is allowed to retake a math quiz after additional practice

accommodations_modifications.name: Provide visual cues and reminders
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps students stay on track and follow routines
accommodations_modifications.example: Student has visual reminders for class routines at their desk

accommodations_modifications.name: Use cooperative learning groups
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Promotes peer support and collaborative learning
accommodations_modifications.example: Student works in a small group to complete a project

accommodations_modifications.name: Limit the number of concepts on a page
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces visual clutter and improves focus
accommodations_modifications.example: Worksheets contain only one or two tasks per page

accommodations_modifications.name: Use mnemonic devices
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports memory for key information
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Trouble remembering math facts or spelling rules
accommodations_modifications.example: Student learns spelling rules using rhymes or acronyms

accommodations_modifications.name: Allow alternative formats for assignments
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Gives flexibility for students to show what they know
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Avoids writing or complex paper-based tasks
accommodations_modifications.example: Student creates a video or visual project instead of writing an essay

accommodations_modifications.name: Provide explicit instruction with modeling
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Demonstrates tasks clearly and sets student up for success
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty understanding what was just read
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher models how to solve a problem step-by-step

accommodations_modifications.name: Use visual timers
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports time management and transitions
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Gets overwhelmed by long assignments or open-ended time
accommodations_modifications.example: Student sees how much time is left using a countdown timer

accommodations_modifications.name: Use a behavior or task contract
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Encourages accountability and goal setting
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Avoids tasks or has low motivation
accommodations_modifications.example: Student sets personal goals and checks off completed work

accommodations_modifications.name: Allow open-book tests
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces stress and supports retrieval of key information
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty recalling specific facts under pressure
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses their notes during social studies quizzes

accommodations_modifications.name: Provide access to manipulatives in math
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Makes abstract math concepts more concrete
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Struggles with math calculations or concepts
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses base-10 blocks to learn place value

accommodations_modifications.name: Provide consistent daily routines
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Creates predictability and reduces anxiety
accommodations_modifications.example: Class follows a predictable schedule posted on the board

accommodations_modifications.name: Teach self-monitoring strategies
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps students reflect on their own learning and behavior
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Frequently off-task or unaware of errors
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a checklist to track completion of steps during writing
